list.name: Changes
list.comment:
Update Sheet Display Based on User Permissions
Adjusted viewSheetHandler to display the sheet only if the user has the appropriate permissions. Server now returns the sheet data solely for authorized users; otherwise, it sends a specific error message to inform users about access restrictions.

task.summary: Default task

changelist.name: Changes
changelist.comment: Starting part 2!!! Some system changes: Mainly in updating a cell using a function: • Input of a function will be considered incorrect only if it is an incorrect structure: unknown function name; Incorrect amount of arguments, etc.). • Input of arguments of the wrong type to the function, either directly (for example: concat(4,5)) or indirectly (for example: in a1 there is a number 4 and then concat(ref(a1),aaa)) is performed - it will be considered a valid input ( that doesn't throw exception) but then the function will get an invalid value (according to its type) • An empty cell has no value. Making a ref to an empty cell is meaningless, but technically it is a valid and proper input. The value of the cell that makes a ref to an empty cell is... the empty cell. -Note: There is one missing case in the "ref" that needs to be addressed

task.summary: commit for merge

Added simulated delay for file loading task in JFX with progress bar
- Implemented JFX Task for file loading with progress bar to provide visual feedback. - Added a simulated delay (1-2 seconds) in each loading step to simulate the process. - Bound progress and status updates to the progress bar and label. - Ensured that the progress bar is hidden upon successful or failed task completion.

Styled Header and Left Panel UI components: - Added visual design improvements to Header section. - Updated Left panel layout for better user experience. - Adjusted styles for TitledPane, ProgressBar, ChoiceBox, ColorPicker, and other UI elements.
Fixed and improved the Scroll behavior and layout for better user experience and smoother navigation.

Added JAR creation and binding for UI interactivity
- Created the JAR file for the project, ensuring all necessary dependencies are included (JavaFX, JAXB, etc.). - Implemented binding for interactive elements (buttons, text fields, choice boxes, etc.), allowing them to be enabled/disabled dynamically based on whether a cell is selected and a file is loaded. - Improved user experience by ensuring UI components are only accessible when relevant actions (like selecting a cell or loading a file) have been completed.

Added dynamic analysis feature with a value range slider for numerical cells.
- Implemented functionality allowing users to select a cell, set a minimum and maximum value, and define the step size. - Added a slider for users to dynamically adjust the selected cell's value within the defined range. - The sheet updates in real-time with each change made by the slider. - Changes are temporary and do not permanently modify the cell's value in the sheet or create a new version.

Implemented theme switching functionality with support for at least 2 additional color schemes beyond the default. The following UI elements were updated as part of the theme changes:
1. Background color for the entire screen. 2. Button styling and appearance across the UI. 3. Updated font and font size for all labels on the screen to reflect the selected theme.
Added a mechanism for users to easily switch between these themes through the UI.

Refactored version selection functionality: - Added dynamic linking between okButton and versionMenuBar to ensure the button is only enabled when a version is selected. - Fixed the dynamic creation of MenuItems and ensured proper action listeners are attached during runtime.
General updates: - Cleaned up several classes. - Added documentation across classes for clarity and future maintenance.

Implemented graph creation feature for numerical data in the sheet.
- Added functionality for generating line and bar charts based on user-selected X and Y axis ranges. - Created error handling for invalid range formats and non-numeric values in the selected cells. - Added detailed validation to ensure the X and Y ranges contain equal numbers of values. - Updated UI to allow users to select cell ranges for graph creation, including new controls for selecting and confirming range input. - Enhanced error messaging for invalid input formats and mismatched value counts between X and Y axis selections. - Documentation and comments added across relevant classes to clarify the graph creation process and error handling mechanisms.

Added minimum window size restrictions to prevent excessive resizing. Updated graph functionality to convert lowercase cell identifiers (e.g., 'a1') to uppercase (e.g., 'A1') for consistency and usability.
- Cleaned up several classes.
final updates before submission

Fixed the handling of Platform.runLater in AppController's loadAndDisplaySheetFromXmlFile method to ensure that UI updates are executed correctly on the JavaFX Application Thread. Added proper lambda syntax for multiple statements.
Improved error handling: The application now properly stops processing if an invalid file or conflicting range is detected during XML file loading. This prevents the application from attempting to display corrupted data after encountering an exception.

Implemented deep copy functionality across multiple components: - Added createDeepCopy method in SheetImpl to handle deep copying of sheets, including copying cells, the range manager, and all related data. - Implemented deep copy for CellImpl, ensuring correct copying of cell dependencies (dependsOn and influencingOn) while avoiding recursion issues with cyclic references. - Added tracking maps in SheetImpl and CellImpl (copiedCells) to prevent infinite recursion during the deep copy process. - Implemented deep copy functionality for RangeImpl and RangeManagerImpl to ensure ranges and their usage counts are copied correctly. - Ensured that all dependent entities such as cells, ranges, and the range manager are copied deeply, maintaining consistency and avoiding shared references between the original and copied sheets.

Implemented deep copy functionality across multiple components: - Added createDeepCopy method in SheetImpl to handle deep copying of sheets, including copying cells, the range manager, and all related data. - Implemented deep copy for CellImpl, ensuring correct copying of cell dependencies (dependsOn and influencingOn) while avoiding recursion issues with cyclic references. - Added tracking maps in SheetImpl and CellImpl (copiedCells) to prevent infinite recursion during the deep copy process. - Implemented deep copy functionality for RangeImpl and RangeManagerImpl to ensure ranges and their usage counts are copied correctly. - Ensured that all dependent entities such as cells, ranges, and the range manager are copied deeply, maintaining consistency and avoiding shared references between the original and copied sheets.
last merge before submit part 2
starting part 3!!!
starting part 3!!! linking the tomcat and dividing it into new models and starting work on login

Implemented unique username validation and login flow for the client
- **Client module**: - Added login flow with `LoginController.java` to handle user input and authentication. - Updated `login.fxml` to define the layout and bind buttons to controller methods. - Created CSS styling in `login.css` for error labels, main action buttons, and quit buttons. - Implemented test classes (`TestLogin.java`, `TestLogin2.java`) for validating login functionality.
- **Engine module**: - Added `UserManager.java` and `UserManagerImpl.java` to handle user management, ensuring that each user has a unique name.
- **Server module**: - `LightweightLoginServlet.java`: Handles basic user login and session creation, ensuring that only unique usernames are allowed. - `LogoutServlet.java`: Manages user logout and session termination. - `ServletUtils.java`: Utility functions for managing user sessions and attributes. - `SessionUtils.java`: Utility functions for session management. - `Constants.java`: Stores constant values used across the application.
- Fixed issues with class loading and servlet integration in the login process.

Prepared FXML and controller structure for dashboard layout
- Created `dashboardHeader.fxml` to define the layout for the header section of the dashboard. - Added `DashboardHeaderController.java` to handle the logic and interaction for the header section. - Organized the project structure under `subcomponents/header` for better modularization. - Added placeholders for subcomponents in the dashboard (availableSheets, commands, and Permissions).

Initial implementation of sheetCellMainController and main FXML for client navigation
- Implemented `sheetCellMainController` to handle the main client logic and navigation between views (login, dashboard, and sheet). - Created the main FXML layout to manage transitions between different screens. - Set up the initial structure for handling view changes dynamically within the client. - Further adjustments and improvements to navigation and layout are needed before finalizing.
fix loadSheet url
fix loadSheet url

Prepared FXML for displaying selected sheet view layout
- Created `selectedSheetView.fxml` to define the layout for displaying the selected sheet. - Added subcomponents: - `selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml` to handle the header section. - `selectedSheetViewLeft.fxml` for the left-side controls (currently placeholders). - `selectedSheet.fxml` for the main sheet display. - Structured the layout to include sections for the available sheets table, permissions table, and commands (view, request permission, acknowledge/deny). - Initial layout setup without implementing functionality or actions.

Implemented SelectedSheetViewHeaderController for handling sheet view header interactions
- Created `SelectedSheetViewHeaderController` to manage user interactions in the header of the selected sheet view. - Added listeners for background color, text color, column width, and row height changes, allowing users to customize cell properties. - Set up initial structure for handling alignment changes (Left, Center, Right) via `ChoiceBox`. - Temporarily disabled certain buttons and controls for future functionality. - Added placeholders for buttons like `BackToDefault`, `LoadFile`, `UpdateValue`, and `VersionSelector` actions (logic to be implemented later). - Implemented bindings to toggle control availability based on selection state.

-Updated SelectedSheetViewController, SelectedSheetViewHeaderController, SelectedSheetViewLeftController, and SelectedSheetController in the client module. - Added detailed documentation for all classes to explain functionality and improve code readability.

-Updated SelectedSheetViewController, SelectedSheetViewHeaderController, SelectedSheetViewLeftController, and SelectedSheetController in the client module. - Added detailed documentation for all classes to explain functionality and improve code readability.
Deleting file upload option from selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml in Client
Deleting file upload option from selectedSheetViewHeader.fxml in Client
add cellServlet to Server
I worked on display sheet from the client and server side, marge for continue work with Amal. It remains to check the feature
Dashboard initialization update The sheets that are already on the server will be displayed straight away.
Transferring objects from server to client works

Successfully implemented JSON-to-object and object-to-JSON conversion for DTOSheet and its components.
The feature for selecting a sheet displaying its contents has been fully integrated.

Implemented available sheets auto-refresh feature.
- Added `AvailableSheetsRefresher` class to periodically fetch and refresh available sheets from the server. - Integrated a timer task in `AvailableSheetsController` to send requests to the server every 2 seconds. - Updated the logic in `refreshAvailableSheets()` to only add new sheets not already present in the client-side list. - Fixed UI update issue by ensuring updates are performed on the JavaFX application thread. - Added logic in the server-side `AvailableSheetServlet` to respond only when new sheets are available, reducing unnecessary updates.
Added sheet sorting functionality on server and client side
Added sheet sorting and filtering functionality on server and client side
set up infrastructure for the version selector feature in sheet view
Version Changes Servlet was established

Completed the implementation of the Version Selector feature. The user can now select a previous version of the sheet, view the number of changes in each version, and load a specific version of the sheet in a new view."
commit for merge

Added dynamic table for available sheets: - Implemented table with columns: Select (checkbox), Sheet Name, Size (nXm), and Uploaded By. - Integrated row selection behavior allowing only one row to be selected at a time. - Added visual highlighting for selected rows with custom styling. - Updated server-side logic to return DTOSheetInfo to dynamically populate the table.
COMMIT FOR MARGE

Implemented sheet selection functionality by row click, ensuring only one row is selected at a time. Added toggle functionality to deselect a row when clicking an already selected one, removing the checkbox check.
Updated sheet name display to show the title instead of the file name in the available sheets table.
create the permission manager in the Engine. added new sheet to permission manager at FileUploadServlet.

Completed implementation of permission request feature and permissions table update.
- Added functionality for requesting permissions on selected sheets. - Implemented logic to check if the user is the owner before allowing a permission request. - Populated the permissions table (`permissionSheetTable`) with current permission data, displaying user name, permission type, and approval status. - Enhanced `PermissionRow` and `AvailableSheetsController` classes to manage permissions data effectively. - Integrated error handling for cases where a permission request already exists (pending or approved). - Improved UI workflow by displaying an error message if no sheet is selected during a request.
Next steps: - Implement functionality to approve or deny permission requests. - Style the permissions table with appropriate colors and formatting for better readability and visual appeal.

Feature: Completed the functionality for handling and approving permission requests. Details: Implemented the approval and denial process, allowing the owner to update user permissions directly. Updated sendApprovalUpdates() to compile updated permissions into a JSON format and send as a POST request. Enhanced the MenuButton in approvalColumn to show appropriate color-coded status (APPROVED/ DENIED) and ensured it updates the status for each user dynamically. Added method to pull selected status from MenuButton to properly set each user's permission status. Outstanding Tasks: Modify certain messages to display as informational rather than errors for better user clarity. Expand logic to handle multiple permission requests for the same user on different permission types within the same sheet (e.g., a user transitioning from READER to WRITER).

Update Sheet Display Based on User Permissions
Adjusted viewSheetHandler to display the sheet only if the user has the appropriate permissions. Server now returns the sheet data solely for authorized users; otherwise, it sends a specific error message to inform users about access restrictions.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Update Sheet Display Based on User Permissions
Adjusted viewSheetHandler to display the sheet only if the user has the appropriate permissions. Server now returns the sheet data solely for authorized users; otherwise, it sends a specific error message to inform users about access restrictions.
